intro: Camptosema paraguariense, commonly known as the Paraguayan milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of this family. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. It produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or white in color. The leaves are alternate and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
